property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.hostname
property.description: The hostname of the RM.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.resource-tracker.address
property.description: The address of ResourceManager.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.address
property.description: The address of the scheduler interface.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.address
property.description: The address of the applications manager interface in the RM.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.admin.address
property.description: The address of the RM admin interface.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.class
property.description: The class to use as the resource scheduler.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.minimum-allocation-mb
property.description: The minimum allocation for every container request at the RM, in MBs. Memory requests lower than this won't take effect, and the specified value will get allocated at minimum.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-mb
property.description: The maximum allocation for every container request at the RM, in MBs. Memory requests higher than this won't take effect, and will get capped to this value.

property.name: yarn.acl.enable
property.description: Are acls enabled.

property.name: yarn.admin.acl
property.description: ACL of who can be admin of the YARN cluster.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.address
property.description: The address of the container manager in the NM.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb
property.description: Amount of physical memory, in MB, that can be allocated for containers.
property.display-name: Memory allocated for all YARN containers on a node

property.name: yarn.application.classpath
property.description: Classpath for typical applications.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-pmem-ratio
property.description: Ratio between virtual memory to physical memory when setting memory limits for containers. Container allocations are expressed in terms of physical memory, and virtual memory usage is allowed to exceed this allocation by this ratio.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.group
property.description: Unix group of the NodeManager

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services
property.description: Auxilliary services of NodeManager. A valid service name should only contain a-zA-Z0-9_ and cannot start with numbers

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services.mapreduce_shuffle.class
property.description: The auxiliary service class to use

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs
property.description: Where to store container logs. An application's localized log directory will be found in ${yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs}/application_${appid}. Individual containers' log directories will be below this, in directories named container_{$contid}. Each container directory will contain the files stderr, stdin, and syslog generated by that container.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs
property.description: List of directories to store localized files in. An application's localized file directory will be found in: ${yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs}/usercache/${user}/appcache/application_${appid}. Individual containers' work directories, called container_${contid}, will be subdirectories of this.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.interval-ms
property.description: The interval, in milliseconds, for which the node manager waits between two cycles of monitoring its containers' memory usage.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.interval-ms
property.description: Frequency of running node health script.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.script.timeout-ms
property.description: Script time out period.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log.retain-seconds
property.description: Time in seconds to retain user logs. Only applicable if log aggregation is disabled.

property.name: yarn.log-aggregation-enable
property.description: Whether to enable log aggregation.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir
property.description: Location to aggregate logs to.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir-suffix
property.description: The remote log dir will be created at {yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir}/${user}/{thisParam}.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.compression-type
property.description: T-file compression types used to compress aggregated logs.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.delete.debug-delay-sec
property.description:
Number of seconds after an application finishes before the nodemanager's DeletionService will delete the application's localized file directory and log directory.
To diagnose Yarn application problems, set this property's value large enough (for example, to 600 = 10 minutes) to permit examination of these directories. After changing the property's value, you must restart the nodemanager in order for it to have an effect.
The roots of Yarn applications' work directories is configurable with the yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs property (see below), and the roots of the Yarn applications' log directories is configurable with the yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs property (see also below).

property.name: yarn.log-aggregation.retain-seconds
property.description: How long to keep aggregation logs before deleting them. -1 disables. Be careful set this too small and you will spam the name node.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.admin-env
property.description: Environment variables that should be forwarded from the NodeManager's environment to the container's.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-healthy-disks
property.description: The minimum fraction of number of disks to be healthy for the nodemanager to launch new containers. This correspond to both yarn-nodemanager.local-dirs and yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs. i.e. If there are less number of healthy local-dirs (or log-dirs) available, then new containers will not be launched on this node.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.am.max-attempts
property.description: The maximum number of application attempts. It's a global setting for all application masters. Each application master can specify its individual maximum number of application attempts via the API, but the individual number cannot be more than the global upper bound. If it is, the resourcemanager will override it. The default number is set to 2, to allow at least one retry for AM.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address
property.description: The address of the RM web application.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.https.address
property.description: The https address of the RM web application.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-check-enabled
property.description: Whether virtual memory limits will be enforced for containers.

property.name: yarn.log.server.url
property.description: URI for the HistoryServer's log resource

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.nodes.exclude-path
property.description: Names a file that contains a list of hosts that are not permitted to connect to the resource manager. The full pathname of the file must be specified. If the value is empty, no hosts are excluded.

property.name: manage.include.files
property.description: If true Ambari will manage include file if yarn.resourcemanager.nodes.include-path is configured.

property.name: yarn.http.policy
property.description: This configures the HTTP endpoint for Yarn Daemons.The following values are supported: - HTTP_ONLY : Service is provided only on http - HTTPS_ONLY : Service is provided only on https

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.enabled
property.description: Indicate to clients whether timeline service is enabled or not. If enabled, clients will put entities and events to the timeline server.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.generic-application-history.store-class
property.description: Store class name for history store, defaulting to file system store

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.address
property.description: The http address of the timeline service web application.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.webapp.https.address
property.description: The http address of the timeline service web application.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.address
property.description: This is default address for the timeline server to start the RPC server.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.ttl-ms
property.description: Time to live for timeline store data in milliseconds.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.ttl-interval-ms
property.description: Length of time to wait between deletion cycles of leveldb timeline store in milliseconds.

property.name: hadoop.registry.rm.enabled
property.description: Is the registry enabled: does the RM start it up, create the user and system paths, and purge service records when containers, application attempts and applications complete

property.name: hadoop.registry.zk.quorum
property.description: List of hostname:port pairs defining the zookeeper quorum binding for the registry

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled
property.description: Enable the node manager to recover after starting

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.dir
property.description: The local filesystem directory in which the node manager will store state when recovery is enabled.

property.name: yarn.client.nodemanager-connect.retry-interval-ms
property.description: Time interval between each attempt to connect to NM

property.name: yarn.client.nodemanager-connect.max-wait-ms
property.description: Max time to wait to establish a connection to NM

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.recovery.enabled
property.description: Enable RM to recover state after starting. If true, then yarn.resourcemanager.store.class must be specified.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.work-preserving-recovery.enabled
property.description: Enable RM work preserving recovery. This configuration is private to YARN for experimenting the feature.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.store.class
property.description: The class to use as the persistent store. If org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.ZKRMStateStore is used, the store is implicitly fenced; meaning a single ResourceManager is able to use the store at any point in time.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-address
property.description: List Host:Port of the ZooKeeper servers to be used by the RM. comma separated host:port pairs, each corresponding to a zk server. e.g. "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002" If the optional chroot suffix is used the example would look like: "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002/app/a" where the client would be rooted at "/app/a" and all paths would be relative to this root - ie getting/setting/etc... "/foo/bar" would result in operations being run on "/app/a/foo/bar" (from the server perspective).

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-state-store.parent-path
property.description: Full path of the ZooKeeper znode where RM state will be stored. This must be supplied when using org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.ZKRMStateStore as the value for yarn.resourcemanager.store.class

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-acl
property.description: ACL's to be used for ZooKeeper znodes.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.work-preserving-recovery.scheduling-wait-ms
property.description: Set the amount of time RM waits before allocating new containers on work-preserving-recovery. Such wait period gives RM a chance to settle down resyncing with NMs in the cluster on recovery, before assigning new containers to applications.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.connect.retry-interval.ms
property.description: How often to try connecting to the ResourceManager.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.connect.max-wait.ms
property.description: Maximum time to wait to establish connection to ResourceManager

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-retry-interval-ms
property.description: "Retry interval in milliseconds when connecting to ZooKeeper. When HA is enabled, the value here is NOT used. It is generated automatically from yarn.resourcemanager.zk-timeout-ms and yarn.resourcemanager.zk-num-retries."

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-num-retries
property.description: Number of times RM tries to connect to ZooKeeper.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.zk-timeout-ms
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout in milliseconds. Session expiration is managed by the ZooKeeper cluster itself, not by the client. This value is used by the cluster to determine when the client's session expires. Expirations happens when the cluster does not hear from the client within the specified session timeout period (i.e. no heartbeat).

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.state-store.max-completed-applications
property.description: The maximum number of completed applications RM state store keeps, less than or equals to ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications}. By default, it equals to ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications}. This ensures that the applications kept in the state store are consistent with the applications remembered in RM memory. Any values larger than ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications} will be reset to ${yarn.resourcemanager.max-completed-applications}. Note that this value impacts the RM recovery performance.Typically, a smaller value indicates better performance on RM recovery.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fs.state-store.retry-policy-spec
property.description: hdfs client retry policy specification. hdfs client retry is always enabled. Specified in pairs of sleep-time and number-of-retries and (t0, n0), (t1, n1), ..., the first n0 retries sleep t0 milliseconds on average, the following n1 retries sleep t1 milliseconds on average, and so on.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.fs.state-store.uri
property.description: RI pointing to the location of the FileSystem path where RM state will be stored. This must be supplied when using org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.recovery.FileSystemRMStateStore as the value for yarn.resourcemanager.store.class

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.ha.enabled
property.description: enable RM HA or not

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.resources-handler.class
property.description: Pre-requisite to use CGroups

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.hierarchy
property.description: Name of the Cgroups hierarchy under which all YARN jobs will be launched

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount
property.description: If true, YARN will automount the CGroup, however the directory needs to already exist; else, the cgroup should be mounted by the admin

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.mount-path
property.description: Path used by the LCE to mount cgroups if not found. This path must exist before the NodeManager is launched.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.cgroups.strict-resource-usage
property.description: Strictly limit CPU resource usage to allocated usage even if spare CPU is available

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.cpu-vcores
property.description: Number of vcores that can be allocated for containers. This is used by the RM scheduler when allocating resources for containers. This is not used to limit the number of CPUs used by YARN containers. If it is set to -1 and yarn.nodemanager.resource.detect-hardware-capabilities is true, it is automatically determined from the hardware in case of Windows and Linux. In other cases, number of vcores is 8 by default.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.percentage-physical-cpu-limit
property.description: The amount of CPU allocated for YARN containers - only effective when used with CGroups
property.display-name: Percentage of physical CPU allocated for all containers on a node

property.name: yarn.node-labels.fs-store.retry-policy-spec
property.description: Retry policy used for FileSystem node label store. The policy is specified by N pairs of sleep-time in milliseconds and number-of-retries "s1,n1,s2,n2,...".

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-free-space-per-disk-mb
property.description: This is related to disk size on the machines, admins should set one of yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-free-space-per-disk-mb or yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.max-disk-utilization-per-disk-percentage but not both. If both are set, the more conservative value will be used

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.max-disk-utilization-per-disk-percentage
property.description: This is related to disk size on the machines, admins should set one of yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-free-space-per-disk-mb or yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.max-disk-utilization-per-disk-percentage but not both. If both are set, the more conservative value will be used

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.roll-monitoring-interval-seconds
property.description: Defines how often NMs wake up to upload log files. The default value is -1. By default, the logs will be uploaded whenthe application is finished. By setting this configure, logs can be uploaded periodically when the application is running. The minimum rolling-interval-seconds can be set is 3600.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.debug-enabled
property.description: This configuration is for debug and test purpose. By setting this configuration as true. We can break the lower bound of yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.roll-monitoring-interval-seconds

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.num-log-files-per-app
property.description: This is temporary solution. The configuration will be deleted once, we find a more scalable method to only write a single log file per LRS.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.system-metrics-publisher.dispatcher.pool-size
property.description: Number of worker threads that send the yarn system metrics data.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.ttl-enable
property.description: Enable age off of timeline store data.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.state-store-class
property.description: Store class name for timeline state store.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-state-store.path
property.description: Store file name for leveldb state store.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.path
property.description: Store file name for leveldb timeline store.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.read-cache-size
property.description: Size of read cache for uncompressed blocks for leveldb timeline store in bytes.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.start-time-read-cache-size
property.description: Size of cache for recently read entity start times for leveldb timeline store in number of entities.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.leveldb-timeline-store.start-time-write-cache-size
property.description: Size of cache for recently written entity start times for leveldb timeline store in number of entities.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.http-authentication.type
property.description: Defines authentication used for the Timeline Server HTTP endpoint. Supported values are: simple | kerberos | $AUTHENTICATION_HANDLER_CLASSNAME

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.delegation-token-auth-filter.enabled
property.description: Flag to enable override of the default kerberos authentication filter with the RM authentication filter to allow authentication using delegation tokens(fallback to kerberos if the tokens are missing). Only applicable when the http authentication type is kerberos.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.bind-host
property.description: Default value is 0.0.0.0, when this is set the service will bind on all interfaces. I think these two options (blank, "0.0.0.0" sans quotes) should be the two available values, with blank as the default.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.bind-host
property.description: Default value is 0.0.0.0, when this is set the service will bind on all interfaces. I think these two options (blank, "0.0.0.0" sans quotes) should be the two available values, with blank as the default.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.bind-host
property.description: Default value is 0.0.0.0, when this is set the service will bind on all interfaces. I think these two options (blank, "0.0.0.0" sans quotes) should be the two available values, with blank as the default.

property.name: yarn.node-labels.fs-store.root-dir
property.description: URI for NodeLabelManager.

property.name: yarn.node-labels.enabled
property.description: Enable node labels to restrict YARN applications so that they run only on cluster nodes that have a specified node label.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-executor.class
property.description: ContainerExecutor for launching containers

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.monitor.enable
property.description: Enable a set of periodic monitors (specified in yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.monitor.policies) that affect the scheduler.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.recovery.enabled
property.description: Enable timeline server to recover state after starting. If true, then yarn.timeline-service.state-store-class must be specified.

property.name: yarn.authorization-provider
property.description: Yarn authorization provider class.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.version
property.description: Timeline service version we’re currently using.

property.name: yarn.system-metricspublisher.enabled
property.description: Enables YARN to publish metrics to timeline v2

property.name: yarn.rm.system-metricspublisher.emit-container-events
property.description: Experimentally enable each container to post timeline events to timeline v2

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.recovery.supervised
property.description: Default of false causes NM to kill its containers on shutdown. Should be set to true when NM recovery is enabled.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.store-class
property.description: Main storage class for YARN timeline server.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.active-dir
property.description: DFS path to store active application’s timeline data

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.done-dir
property.description: DFS path to store done application’s timeline data

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.group-id-plugin-classes
property.description: Plugins that can translate a timeline entity read request into a list of timeline cache ids, separated by commas.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.summary-store
property.description: Summary storage for ATS v1.5

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.scan-interval-seconds
property.description: Scan interval for ATS v1.5 entity group file system storage reader.This value controls how frequent the reader will scan the HDFS active directory for application status.

property.name: yarn.log.server.web-service.url
property.description: Log Server Web Service URL.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.cleaner-interval-seconds
property.description: Scan interval for ATS v1.5 entity group file system storage cleaner.This value controls how frequent the reader will scan the HDFS done directory for stale application data.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.retain-seconds
property.description: How long the ATS v1.5 entity group file system storage will keep an application's data in the done directory.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services.spark_shuffle.class
property.description: The auxiliary service class to use for Spark

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services.spark2_shuffle.class
property.description: The auxiliary service class to use for Spark 2

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-metrics.unregister-delay-ms
property.description: The delay time ms to unregister container metrics after completion.

property.name: yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.group-id-plugin-classpath
property.description: Classpath for all plugins defined in yarn.timeline-service.entity-group-fs-store.group-id-plugin-classes.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.monitor.capacity.preemption.total_preemption_per_round
property.description: This option controls the pace at which containers-marked-for-preemption are actually preempted in each period.

property.name: yarn.resourcemanager.monitor.capacity.preemption.natural_termination_factor
property.description: Similar to total_preemption_per_round, we can apply this factor to slowdown resource preemption after preemption-target is computed for each queue.
